div.style: position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; left: 0px; background: #FFFFFF;

div.span: HARPURSVILLE CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT IS CLOSED

Per the Executive Orders of the Governor and County Executive, our schools and campus remain closed from now through May 15, 2020. This includes all extra-curricular activities, as well as playgrounds, athletic fields, basketball courts, etc.
Please continue to visit the district website for up-to-date information. We have created a special page dedicated to updates and resources dealing with the Coronavirus. Click here to access.
We thank you for your continued patience and support. There is nothing more important than the health, safety, and well-being of our entire school community. Be well!

div.span: New web page dedicated to Coronavirus

br.span: To help residents stay up-to-date on the rapidly changing Coronavirus concern, we have created a special page decided to providing important information and resources dealing with the COVID-19 pandemic. To access the page, click here.
On April 16, Governor Cuomo announced that NYS on Pause has been extended through May 15th. This means that all non-essential workers must continue to work from home and schools will remain closed.

div.a: Free meals for students during school closure

br.span: Click here to view a letter from Superintendent Michael Rullo regarding accessing free meals for students during the period of school closure.
For a letter containing updates regarding the coronavirus from Superintendent Michael Rullo, please click here.
